00050 #define BGE_FONT_RES 100

00053 int GetFontId(VFont *font);
00054 
00055 std::vector<STR_String> split_string(STR_String str)
00056 {
00057     std::vector<STR_String> text = std::vector<STR_String>();
00058 
00059     /* Split the string upon new lines */
00060     int begin=0, end=0;
00061     while (end < str.Length())
00062     {
00063         if (str.GetAt(end) == '\n')
00064         {
00065             text.push_back(str.Mid(begin, end-begin));
00066             begin = end+1;
00067         }
00068         end++;
00069     }
00070     //Now grab the last line
00071     text.push_back(str.Mid(begin, end-begin));
00072 
00073     return text;
00074 }
00075 
00076 KX_FontObject::KX_FontObject(   void* sgReplicationInfo,
00077                                 SG_Callbacks callbacks,
00078                                 RAS_IRenderTools* rendertools,
00079                                 Object *ob):
00080     KX_GameObject(sgReplicationInfo, callbacks),
00081     m_object(ob),
00082     m_dpi(72),
00083     m_resolution(1.f),
00084     m_rendertools(rendertools)
00085 {
00086     Curve *text = static_cast<Curve *> (ob->data);
00087     m_text = split_string(text->str);
00088     m_fsize = text->fsize;
00089     m_line_spacing = text->linedist;
00090     m_offset = MT_Vector3(text->xof, text->yof, 0);
00091     
00092     m_fontid = GetFontId(text->vfont);
00093     
00094     /* initialize the color with the object color and store it in the KX_Object class
00095      * This is a workaround waiting for the fix:
00096      * [#25487] BGE: Object Color only works when it has a keyed frame */
00097     copy_v4_v4(m_color, (const float*) ob->col);
00098     this->SetObjectColor((const MT_Vector4&) m_color);
00099 }

00107 CValue* KX_FontObject::GetReplica()
00108 {
00109     KX_FontObject* replica = new KX_FontObject(*this);
00110     replica->ProcessReplica();
00111     return replica;
00112 }

00114 void KX_FontObject::ProcessReplica()
00115 {
00116     KX_GameObject::ProcessReplica();
00117     KX_GetActiveScene()->AddFont(this);
00118 }

00120 int GetFontId (VFont *font)
00121 {
00122     PackedFile *packedfile=NULL;
00123     int fontid = -1;
00124 
00125     if (font->packedfile) {
00126         packedfile= font->packedfile;
00127         fontid= BLF_load_mem(font->name, (unsigned char*)packedfile->data, packedfile->size);
00128         
00129         if (fontid == -1) {
00130             printf("ERROR: packed font \"%s\" could not be loaded.\n", font->name);
00131             fontid = BLF_load("default");
00132         }
00133         return fontid;
00134     }
00135     
00136     /* once we have packed working we can load the FO_BUILTIN_NAME font */
00137     const char *filepath = font->name;
00138     if (strcmp(FO_BUILTIN_NAME, filepath) == 0) {
00139         fontid = BLF_load("default");
00140         
00141         /* XXX the following code is supposed to work (after you add get_builtin_packedfile to BKE_font.h )
00142          * unfortunately it's crashing on blf_glyph.c:173 because gc->max_glyph_width is 0
00143          */
00144         // packedfile=get_builtin_packedfile();
00145         // fontid= BLF_load_mem(font->name, (unsigned char*)packedfile->data, packedfile->size);
00146         // return fontid;
00147 
00148         return BLF_load("default");
00149     }
00150     
00151     /* convert from absolute to relative */
00152     char expanded[256]; // font names can be bigger than FILE_MAX (240)
00153     BLI_strncpy(expanded, filepath, 256);
00154     BLI_path_abs(expanded, G.main->name);
00155     
00156     fontid = BLF_load(expanded);
00157 
00158     /* fallback */
00159     if (fontid == -1)
00160         fontid = BLF_load("default");
00161     
00162     return fontid;
00163 }
00164 
00165 void KX_FontObject::DrawText()
00166 {
00167     /* Allow for some logic brick control */
00168     if (this->GetProperty("Text"))
00169         m_text = split_string(this->GetProperty("Text")->GetText());
00170 
00171     /* only draws the text if visible */
00172     if (this->GetVisible() == 0) return;
00173 
00174     /* update the animated color */
00175     this->GetObjectColor().getValue(m_color);
00176 
00177     /* HARDCODED MULTIPLICATION FACTOR - this will affect the render resolution directly */
00178     const float RES = BGE_FONT_RES * m_resolution;
00179 
00180     const float size = m_fsize * this->NodeGetWorldScaling()[0] * RES;
00181     const float aspect = m_fsize / size;
00182 
00183     /* Get a working copy of the OpenGLMatrix to use */
00184     double mat[16];
00185     memcpy(mat, this->GetOpenGLMatrix(), sizeof(double)*16);
00186 
00187     /* Account for offset */
00188     MT_Vector3 offset = this->NodeGetWorldOrientation() * m_offset * this->NodeGetWorldScaling();
00189     mat[12] += offset[0]; mat[13] += offset[1]; mat[14] += offset[2];
00190 
00191     /* Orient the spacing vector */
00192     MT_Vector3 spacing = MT_Vector3(0, m_fsize*m_line_spacing, 0);
00193     spacing = this->NodeGetWorldOrientation() * spacing * this->NodeGetWorldScaling()[1];
00194 
00195     /* Draw each line, taking spacing into consideration */
00196     for (int i=0; i<m_text.size(); ++i)
00197     {
00198         if (i!=0)
00199         {
00200             mat[12] -= spacing[0];
00201             mat[13] -= spacing[1];
00202             mat[14] -= spacing[2];
00203         }
00204         m_rendertools->RenderText3D(m_fontid, m_text[i], int(size), m_dpi, m_color, mat, aspect);
00205     }
00206 }

00246 PyAttributeDef KX_FontObject::Attributes[] = {

00255 PyObject* KX_FontObject::pyattr_get_text(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef)
00256 {
00257     KX_FontObject* self= static_cast<KX_FontObject*>(self_v);
00258     STR_String str = STR_String();
00259     for (int i=0; i<self->m_text.size(); ++i)
00260     {
00261         if (i!=0)
00262             str += '\n';
00263         str += self->m_text[i];
00264     }
00265     return PyUnicode_From_STR_String(str);
00266 }
00267 
00268 int KX_FontObject::pyattr_set_text(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef, PyObject *value)
00269 {
00270     KX_FontObject* self= static_cast<KX_FontObject*>(self_v);
00271     if (!PyUnicode_Check(value))
00272         return PY_SET_ATTR_FAIL;
00273     char* chars = _PyUnicode_AsString(value);
00274 
00275     /* Allow for some logic brick control */
00276     CValue* tprop = self->GetProperty("Text");
00277     if (tprop) {
00278         CValue *newstringprop = new CStringValue(STR_String(chars), "Text");
00279         self->SetProperty("Text", newstringprop);
00280         newstringprop->Release();
00281     }
00282     else {
00283         self->m_text = split_string(STR_String(chars));
00284     }
00285 
00286     return PY_SET_ATTR_SUCCESS;
00287 }
